text:
entary feeding, referring to appropriate feeding starting at 
six months of age, means that the infant receives breast milk (including milk expressed or from a 
wet-nurse) or a breast-milk substitute and solid or semi-solid food. 
Complementary foods include those that are manufactured or locally prepared, suitable as a 
complement to breast milk or to a breast-milk substitute when either becomes insufficient to 
22
Essential Nutrition Actions: improving maternal, newborn, infant and young child
